citation.article-title: Thermoanaerobacterium aotearoense sp. nov., a slightly acidophilic, anaerobic thermophile isolated from various hot springs in New Zealand, and emendation of the genus Thermoanaerobacterium.

p.s: Emendation of the description of the genus Thermoanaerobacterium.

The genus Thermoanaerobacterium was validly described by Lee et al. (16), who found that sulfur droplets could not be detected inside the cells. We found that the sulfur droplets formed during growth in the presence of thiosulfate (20 mM) are located in the cytoplasm of Thermoanaerobacterium aotearoense and Thermoanaerobacterium thermosulfrigenes cells. In addition, the pH at which growth occurs ranges from around pH 3.8 (Thermoanaerobacterium aotearoense) to higher than 8.5 (Thermoanaerobacterium thermosaccharolyticum).
